turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Professor Scott, if you'll --

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I demand to see the owners! I demand --

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: With pleasure.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Well, that's different.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: If you'll follow me, Professor --

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I will. Can my assistant come, too?

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Doctor Nichols, I might have something to offer <u>you</u>.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: ... Yes?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I notice you're still working with polymers.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Sill? What else would I be working with?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Ah, what else indeed? Let me put it another way: how thick would a piece of your plexiglass need to be at 60 feet by 10 feet to withstand the pressure of 18,000 cubic feet of water?

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: That's easy: 6 inches. We carry stuff that big in stock.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Yes, I noticed. Now suppose -- just suppose -- I could show you a way to manufacture a wall that would do the same job but was only an inch thick. would that be worth something to you, eh?

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: ... Are you joking?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Hello? Computer...?

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Just use the keyboard...

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: The keyboard... How quaint.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Transparent aluminum?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: That's the ticket, laddie.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: ... But it would take years just to figure out the dynamics of this matrix...!

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Hi. Huey 205, isn't it?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Right on. You fly?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Oh, here and there.  I flew something similar in my Academy days.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: All right, then this is old stuff to you.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Old, yes. But interesting.  Do you mind if I ask a few questions...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Father...?

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: I will be returning to Vulcan within the hour... I wanted to take my leave of you.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It is kind of you to make this effort.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: It is not an effort. You are my son.  Besides; I am most impressed with your performance in this -- crises.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Most kind, Father.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: As I recall, I opposed your enlistment in Starfleet... It is possible that judgment was incorrect.  Your associates are people of good character.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They are my friends.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Yes, of course... Do you have any message for your mother?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Tell her I feel fine...

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: Ojichan? Akira ojichaan dewa naino? Koko de nani shiteru no?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Gomen nasarei. Hito chigai de gozaranuka na.  I'm sorry, my son. You have mis- taken me for someone else.

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: Ah, chigaau hito da. Hanashi kata ga okashii.  Yes, this must be true. You talk funny.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Chotto omachi nasarei. Namae wa nanto moosareruka na.  Wait my son. What is your name?

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: Sulu Hikaru.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Ah, sorenara mazu mazu nagaiki wo sareru to mira.  Ah... Then I am sure that you will have a long and happy life.

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: Arigato. Sayonara.  Thank you, honorable sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We were under the impression they were being held against their will.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: It's not our custom to have guests here at all, let alone hold anyone against their will.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: My people have a strict policy of non-interference with other cultures. In fact, it's our Prime Directive.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Your directive apparently doesn't include spying on other cultures.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If I were in your shoes, I'd feel the same way after what happened.  The 'artificial lifeform' is a member of my crew. Apparently, he became... ill...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You have warp capability?

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Capability, yes. But where can warp drive take us, except away from here...?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I understand how you feel. We just want to retrace Data's movements that day...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I don't like to leave questions unanswered.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Then you must spend your life answering questions.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: I know what a hologram is, Captain. The question is -- why would someone want to create one of our village?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Data, if you were following the boy and discovered this ship...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Deceive us?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: To move you off this planet. You go to sleep one night in your village... wake up the next morning in this flying holodeck transported en masse. A week later, maybe a month, you've been relocated on a similar planet without ever realizing it.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Don't panic...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: I've been shot at... thrown into the lake out of an invisible ship that's come to abduct us all... what's there to panic about?

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: There's an unusual metaphasic radiation coming from the planet's rings. It continuously regenerates the cells in our bodies. You must have noticed the effects by now.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We've... just begun to.  I suppose you're seventy-five.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Clearly, the architects of this conspiracy have tried to keep it a secret. Not just from you, but from my people as well.  I don't intend to let them.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: We've always known that to survive, we had to remain apart. It hasn't been easy. Many of the young people here want to know more about the offland... they're attracted to stories of a faster pace of life...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Most of my people who live that faster pace would sell their souls to slow it down.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: But not you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There are days.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: You don't live up to your reputation as an offlander, Picard.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: In defense of offlanders, there are many more like me...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: ... who wouldn't be tempted by the promise of perpetual youth? I don't think so.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You give me more credit than I deserve. Of course, I'm tempted. Who wouldn't be?  But some of the blackest marks in the history of my world have involved the forced relocation of a small group of people to satisfy the demands of a larger one. I'd like to believe we learn from our mistakes. Obviously, some of us haven't.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The craftsmanship is extraordinary.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: This is a school... that's a student's work.  She'll be ready to become an apprentice soon. Then, in thirty or forty years, she'll take her place among the artisans...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: An apprentice for thirty years.  We've noticed your people's mental discipline. Did that develop here?

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: More questions. Always the explorer. If you stay long enough, that'll change.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Will it?

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: You'll stop reviewing what happened yesterday... stop planning for tomorrow... until you find...  Let me ask you a question -- have you ever experienced a perfect moment in time?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A perfect moment?

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: When time seemed to stop... and you could almost live in that moment...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Seeing my home planet from space for the first time...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Yes. Exactly. Nothing more complicated than perception.  You explore the universe. We've discovered a single moment in time can be a universe in itself... full of powerful forces... most people aren't aware enough of the now... to ever notice them...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I wish I could spare a few centuries to learn.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: It took us centuries to learn that it doesn't have to take centuries to learn.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There's one thing I don't understand.  In three hundred years...you never learned to swim?

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: I just... haven't gotten around to it yet.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: I wonder if you're aware of the trust you endanger, Jean-Luc Picard. In my experience, it's unusual for...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: ... an offlander?

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: For someone so young.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: When we're forced away by the terrain, we'll use transport inhibitors to compensate. The mountains have the highest concentrations. Once we're there, transport will be virtually impossible...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: There are caves in those mountains.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We can hold them off a long time... once we get there...  But they will not make it easy to get there...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Jak'tahla?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Roughly translated: puberty... although for a Klingon that's not doing it justice...  Any severe mood swings, unusual aggressive tendencies -- be sure to let me know right away...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Right beyond that ridge is where the caves begin... we can hide for days...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: By now the Son'a have scanned the area and know that just as well as we do.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How is it a woman like you never married? And don't tell me you "just haven't gotten around to it yet"...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: What's the rush?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I should warn you... I've always been attracted to older women...

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: There's a cavern at the base of the next hill...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: This way!

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: You're Ro'tin, aren't you...? There's something in the voice.  Would you be his friend Gal'na?  I helped your mother bathe you when you were a child. She still speaks of you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You've brought the Federation into the middle of a blood feud, Admiral. The children have returned to expel their elders... just as they were once expelled. Except Ru'afo's need for revenge has now escalated to parricide.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Mother and son. You arranged this...?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I thought it might begin the healing process.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: But I have three hundred and eighteen days of vacation time coming. I plan on using them.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: I'll be here.

turns.speaker: ANIJ
turns.text: Do you really think your mighty Federation would be interested in protecting six hundred people?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The "mighty" Federation could learn a few things from this village...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: There is no need for concern. I am operating within normal parameters now.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: You're what?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I am better.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: My father told me I shouldn't talk to you.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Not everyone here agrees with him. I mean, you know, about machines. There was even a big fight about it once.  Do you like being a machine?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I aspire to be more than I am.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: I know why.  So people like us won't be afraid of you any more.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Perhaps, that is true.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Don't you ever get tired?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: My power cells continually re- charge themselves.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: I can't imagine what it would be like to be a machine.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Perhaps it would surprise you to know that I have often tried to imagine what it would be like to be a child...

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: For one thing, your legs are shorter than everyone else's.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: But they are in a constant state of growth. Do you find it difficult to adapt?  A child's specifications are never the same from one moment to the next. I am surprised that you do not... trip over your own feet.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Sometimes I do.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: My legs are eighty-seven-point- two centimeters. They were eighty-seven-point-two centimeters the day I was created. They will be eighty- seven-point-two centimeters the day I go off line. My operation depends on specifications that do not change.  I... cannot imagine... the experience of growing up or even tripping over my own feet...

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: But you've never had adults telling you what to do all the time... or bedtimes... or having to eat food you don't like...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I would gladly accept the requirement of a bedtime in exchange for knowing what it is like to be a child.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Do machines ever play?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I play the violin... and my chess routines are quite advanced...

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: No, I mean...

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Chase me!

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: For what purpose?

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Because you're it. And if you tag me... then I'm it.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: But I can run much faster than you... I am capable of exceeding forty-seven meters per second...

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Data... haven't you ever just played... for fun?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Androids... don't have...fun.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Why not...?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No one's ever asked me that before.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: If you want to know 'what it's like to be a child', you need to learn how to play...

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Anij!

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Tournel will take you the rest of the way...

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: No... I want to stay with you...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: It is safer there. I will join you shortly.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I have to go home now.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Can he breathe under water?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Data doesn't breathe.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: Won't he rust?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: To many offlanders, what you have here would be more valuable than gold-pressed latinum.  And I'm afraid it's the reason that someone is trying to take this world away from you.

turns.speaker: ARTIM
turns.text: The artificial lifeform was right?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If not for Data, you'd probably have been re-located by now.

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: Captain, the Son'a hostages declined to be examined. I had them confined to quarters.

turns.speaker: PICARD'S COM VOICE
turns.text: And our people?

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: They all have slightly elevated levels of endorphin production... probably the result of the environmental anomalies here...

turns.speaker: PICARD'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Are they in any danger?

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: Not at all. They're fine... in fact, they're better than fine. Increased metabolism, high energy, improved muscle tone. We should all be so lucky.

turns.speaker: PICARD'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Very good, Doctor. Picard out.

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: You either need a new uniform or a new neck.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: 'Yew-cheen chef-faw'... My collar size is exactly the same as it was at the Academy.

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: Sure it is. And your hair is still chestnut brown.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Very funny...

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: Your Captain used to cut quite a rug...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Prepare to transport the 'hostages' to the ship...

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: They should be quarantined before joining the ship's population.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Will he live?

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: Yes. But look at this medscan...

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: She's stabilizing.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Is it safe to move her?

turns.speaker: CRUSHER
turns.text: Safer than leaving her here.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Hello, Data...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Captain, Geordi...?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You're aboard the Enterprise.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Yes... that looks like them.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What's the last thing you remember, Data...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: 'his nose should pant and his lip should curl...'

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: From the mission...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I was in an isolation suit collecting physiometric data on Ba'ku children. My last memory is going into the hills, following a boy...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I believe the boy is... afraid... of me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It's nothing personal data. You have to remember these people have rejected technology. And you...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: ... I am the personification of everything they have rejected.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Until this week, that young man probably never saw a  machine, let alone one that walks and talks...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: And I do not believe I made a very good first impression.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Tricorder functions are limited due to heavy deposits of kelbonite in these hills...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How about a passive radiation scan?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A ship,

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: It is clearly Federation in origin, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: 'Just a few loose ends to tie up.'

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Incomplete, I might add.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What you're seeing is a computer driven image created by photons and forcefields...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: ... it is conceivable I was shot to protect the secret of its existence.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What possible purpose could a duplicate village have except... to deceive the Ba'ku...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Why would the Federation or the Son'a wish to move the Ba'ku?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Captain, I've activated transport inhibitors around the village...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Good. Let's begin to move these people out...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Another forty-three people reported taken, sir...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I'm showing fresh air  behind this calcite formation, Captain...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Will the structure hold if we blast through?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I believe it is safe, sir.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Your Federation procedures have made this mission ten times as difficult as it needed to be...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Our procedures were in place to protect the planet's population from unnecessary risk...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Planet's population. Six hundred people. You want to avoid unnecessary risks? Next time leave your android home.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Take us into a high orbit.  Lie down, Admiral. The girls will take twenty years off your face...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Another time.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Your self-restraint puzzles me, Admiral. You continue to deny yourself every benefit this mission has to offer...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: I prefer to wait until we can share the benefits with all the people of the Federation...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Your android has turned dangerously violent, Captain... Considerable damage was done to my ship. He must be destroyed.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: I know what Data means to Starfleet, Jean-Luc... but our crew is at the mercy of those people on the planet...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: It isn't safe for you to remain in this area.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: He's right. Our shields have been upgraded to protect against the environmental anomalies...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Take me down. Let me talk to Picard.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Talk... we should send down an assault team and take them by force.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: That is not an acceptable option. If people get hurt, all the support we have in the Federation...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Federation support, Federation procedures, Federation rules... look in the mirror, Admiral... the Federation is old... in the last twenty four months, it's been challenged by every major power in the quadrant -- the Borg, the Cardassians, the Dominion... they all smell the scent of death on the Federation. That's why you've embraced our offer... because it will give your dear Federation new life. Well, how badly do you want it, Admiral? Because there are hard choices to be made now. If the Enterprise gets through with news about their brave Captain's valiant struggle on behalf of the defenseless Ba'ku, your Federation politicians will waver, your Federation opinion polls will open a public debate, your Federation allies will want their say... need I go on?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: I'll order Riker to turn around.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Picard's first officer. Do you really believe he'll listen?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: You're not going to launch anything until...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: In six hours, every living thing in this system will be dead or dying.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: We're taking this ship out of here... this mission is over...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: It is not over.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: It is over.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: I do not take orders from you.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: If you begin the procedure while the planet is still populated, the Federation will pursue you until...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You have no idea what precipitated his behavior?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: ... And now he's holding our people hostage down there...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The Enterprise can be at your position in two days, Admiral...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: That's probably not a good idea. Your ship hasn't been fitted for this region; there are environmental concerns...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What kind of concerns?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: We haven't fully identified the anomalies yet. They're calling this whole area The Briar Patch... it took us a day to reach a location where we could get a signal out to you. Just get me Data's schematics. I'll keep you informed.  Dougherty out.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Captain, I wasn't expecting you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: This was too important for the Enterprise to be on the sidelines, Admiral...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: I wish I had better news. Commander Data attacked us in the mission scout ship yesterday. Ru'afo and I have decided to send in an assault team...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Sir, Commander Worf and I have been working on several tactical plans to safely...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: All right. You have twelve hours, Captain. Then I want you out of The Briar Patch. In the meantime, we'll be heading out to the perimeter to call for Son'a reinforcements in case you fail.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Understood.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Good luck. Dougherty out.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: ... and because they have warp capabilities, the consequences to their society are minimal...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: You've done a terrific job, Jean- Luc. Now, pack your bags and get the hell out of there. How's Data?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: In stasis. La Forge is completing the diagnostic.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: I'll need all your paperwork tomorrow. We're heading back your way. Set a course to rendezvous with us so you can transfer the crew and equipment on your way out.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You're not finished here?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Just a few loose ends to tie up. Dougherty out.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: You're looking well, Jean-Luc. Rested.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Your "Briar Patch" turned out to be more hospitable than I expected.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: That's why we put chromodynamic shields in place - so our people wouldn't feel the effects from the metaphasic radiation...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: ... or understand that they were participating in the outright theft of a world.  I won't let you move them, Admiral. I'll go to the Federation Council...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: I'm acting on orders form the Federation Council.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How can there be an order to abandon the Prime Directive...?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: The Prime Directive doesn't apply. These people are not indigenous to this world. They were never meant to be immortal. We'll simply be restoring their natural evolution.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Who are we to decide the next course of evolution for these people?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: There are six hundred people down there. We'll be able to use the regenerative properties of this radiation to help billions.  The Son'a have developed a procedure to collect the metaphasic particles form the planets rings...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A planet in Federation space...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Right. We have the planet and they have the technology -- a technology we can't duplicate. You know what that makes us? Their partners.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Our partners are nothing more than petty thugs.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: On Earth, petroleum once turned petty thugs into world leaders. Warp drive transformed a bunch of Romulan thugs into an empire. We can handle the Son'a, I'm not worried about that...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Someone probably said the same thing about the Romulans a century ago.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: With metaphasics, lifespans will be doubled... an entire new medical science will evolve...  I understand your Chief Engineer has the use of his eyes for the first time in his life... would you take his sight away from him?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There are metaphasic particles all over The Briar Patch. Why must this planet be...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: The concentration in the rings is what makes the whole damned thing work. Don't ask me to explain it. I only know they inject something into the rings that starts a thermolytic reaction. After it's over, the planet will be unlivable for generations.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Delay the procedure. Let my people look at the technology.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Our best scientific minds already have. We can't find any other way to do this.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Then the Son'a can establish a separate colony on this planet until we do...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: It would take ten years of normal exposure to begin to reverse their condition. Some of them won't survive that long. Besides, they don't want to live in the middle of The Briar Patch... who would?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The Ba'ku.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We are betraying the principles upon which the Federation was founded... this is an attack on the very soul of the Federation.  This will destroy the Ba'ku. Just as cultures have been destroyed in every other forced relocation throughout history.

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: We are only moving six hundred people, Jean-Luc.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How many people would it take... before it becomes wrong? A thousand? Fifty thousand. A million?

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: Order them to surrender, and I promise you won't be court- martialed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If a court-martial is the only way to tell the people of the Federation what happened here, then I welcome it.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I wonder... which one of us will be facing that court-martial...

turns.speaker: DOUGHERTY
turns.text: There's nothing further to be gained from this...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A coward... without the moral courage to stop an unspeakable atrocity. You offend me.

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: Is this how a Federation officer begs for his life?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm not begging for my life. I'm begging for yours.  There is still a way home, Gal'na.

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: What you're asking me to do... is impossible... the crew is loyal to Ru'afo...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Do you know how to disable the injector?

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: But I would need at least three minutes on the bridge.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If we could lure him away from the bridge...

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: It doesn't matter where he is. As soon as he realizes something is happening, he'll override my commands with one word at his com- link...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What if he doesn't realize something's happening...  Can you get me to a transmitter? I have to speak with Worf and Data on the surface... we'll need their help...

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: The countdown control has been transferred to the collector...I can't override...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Scan for lifesigns.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Gallatin! So the righteous Starfleet Captain finally released you. Did you encounter any problems on the surface?

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: No, sir. But it wasn't easy... being among them...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: I'm sure. Just don't forget what they did to us.  We'll have them rounded up in a day or two... we needn't bother with the Federation holo-ship any more. Just get the holding cells ready.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: The injector performs perfectly in every simulation...

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: Sir, as the Enterprise left orbit, one of their support craft went down to the surface.  It appeared to be the Captain's Yacht. Five persons on board.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: We're not waiting until morning... take the shuttles and get everyone off the surface tonight.

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: They're following the kelbonite deposits... using the interference to block our transporters...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Recommendations?

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: There is an alternative to an all- out assault. Isolinear tags would allow our transporters to lock on to them.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: We'd have to tag every one of them... that would take time... and we don't have it. The Enterprise is only nineteen hours from communications range with the Federation...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Admiral Dougherty will not be joining us for diner. Deploy the collector.  Do you have a problem with those orders?

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: May I talk to you alone?

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Deploy the collector.

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: Moving them is one thing. Killing them all...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: No one hated them more than you, Gal'na.  We've come a long way together. This is the moment we've planned for so many years...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Separate the Starfleet personnel and secure them in the aft cargo hold... see that Picard joins them...

turns.speaker: GALLATIN
turns.text: The shields in that section won't protect them against the thermolytic reaction...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Thank-you for reminding me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I want our guests to depart as quickly a etiquette allows. I'll ask Worf to delay his return to DS9 so he can join us. We're going to stop by sector four-four- one on our way to the Goren system.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: They... are in opposite directions, sir...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Are they...?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: We're about to lose communications with Starfleet, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Do you have everything you need from command?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: The torque sensors are out of alignment... by twelve microns... you could hear that?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: When I was an ensign, I could detect a three-micron mis- alignment...

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: I took these out of Data's neural net... they contain memory engrams...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Do you know how they were damaged?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: By a Son'a weapon.  There's no doubt about it, sir. That's what made Data malfunction.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The Son'a reports claim they didn't fire until after he malfunctioned.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: I don't believe it happened that way.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Why would they fire at him without provocation?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: All I know is that he was functioning normally until he was shot. Then, his fail-safe system was activated...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Fail-safe?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: His ethical and moral subroutines took over all of his basic functions...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: So, you're saying he still knew the difference between right and wrong.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: In a sense, that's all he knew. The system is designed to protect him against anyone who might try to take advantage of his memory loss.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: And yet he attacked us. And told the Ba'ku we were a threat...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Implants bothering you?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: It's nothing. I'm just tired.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: Funniest thing, Captain. There wasn't anything wrong with my implants. There was something right with my eyes. When Doctor Crusher removed the ocular connections, she found the cells around my optic nerves...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: ... had regenerated.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: It may not last after we leave. If not, I just wanted, before we go...  I've never actually seen a sunrise.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: A photon torpedo.  Isn't that the universal greeting when communications are down?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: I think it's the universal greeting when you don't like someone.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Full impulse.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: The manifold can't handle full impulse in the Patch, Commander.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: If we don't outrun them, the manifolds are going to be the only thing left of this ship.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: I'll be in Engineering.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Will that stop the tear?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: You got me, Commander.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: That's your expert opinion?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: Detonating the warp core might neutralize the cascade... but then again it might not. Subspace weapons are unpredictable. That's why they were banned.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: We're pulling it like a zipper across space...

turns.speaker: RIKER'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Options?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: Eject the core.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: Aye, sir. Highly volatile...I recommend we keep our distance...

turns.speaker: RIKER'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Negative. I want to use the ramscoop to collect as much of it as we can...

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: The purpose being...?

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: I wouldn't be surprised if history remembers this as the Riker Maneuver...

turns.speaker: RIKER'S COM VOICE
turns.text: If it works you mean.

turns.speaker: LA FORGE
turns.text: Even if it doesn't, they'll be teaching kids as the Academy not to do this for years to come.

turns.speaker: NARA
turns.text: I don't think they believe us.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Why not?
